meanings.definition: Referring back to a word or phrase mentioned earlier in a text.
meanings.sent1: The anaphoric pronoun 'it' refers back to the noun 'book'.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the anaphoric pronoun 'they' helped to connect the ideas.
meanings.sent3: The anaphoric pronoun 'he' got confused and pointed at the wrong person.
meanings.sent4: Her anaphoric pronoun use was like a trail of breadcrumbs leading the reader back.
meanings.sent5: Using an anaphoric pronoun can make the writing clearer and more cohesive.

meanings.definition: Relating to anaphora, the use of a word or phrase to refer back to another word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: The anaphoric technique enhanced the flow of the paragraph.
meanings.sent2: His anaphoric style of writing made the connections between ideas stronger.
meanings.sent3: The anaphoric reference added a touch of elegance to the sentence.
meanings.sent4: Her anaphoric language wove a web of interconnected thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The anaphoric nature of the poem created a sense of unity throughout.
